TopicTitle: Just noticed Kerbals have one eye smaller than the other!

Articles.Content:
Was looking at my Jeb model from Shapeways and then noticed his left eye is bit smaller then the right. So I thought hmmmm maybe its an error in the 3D printing but I'd heard that the Shapeways model is made directly from the game 3d model. So had a look at the Kerbals in game and realised it is true!

So what ideas you you guys have as to why Kerbals evolved one eye bigger than the other?
Constant surprise?

yeah, and you cant unsee it. ever. so from here on, any time you look at any of your kerbals faces, it will be all you are capable of perceiving, you may even be rendered temporarily mute by this phenomena.

You cannot undo what you have wrought up these forum goers....

O.o

Eternally skeptical. O_o

Cannot unsee++
It's an easter egg.

Thanks a lot.

Now I will never be able to look at another Kerbal's face without seeing this.

< Oh wait, the emoticons don't have it! Yeeea- but I'm still seeing it.

The Kerbals also have a bad case of "walleye", in that both eyes aim outward, and never converge on the same object they're viewing.

Edited August 22, 2014 by NecroBones
Oh yes definitely impossible to unsee it, what staggers me is I played this game 18 months without seeing it and 8 months I've had the Shapeways model and didn't see it there either until now.
Haha, I acutally noticed that a few times already when zooming in on my kerbals in game, but I always though it was a perception trick or just my imagination
Doctor's note or it didn't happen.

*unsees it*

What are we talking about now? ^^

It's an easter egg.

I've been told it has been a modeling error. And by a developer, even.
Keep the discussion clean, please guys.

I don't know anything about eyes but..

Maybe one eye for seeing near thinks and one for far things? And remember that in IVA, a Kerbal's vision can zoom up to like x20.

0_o
It seems that Kerbonaut tests didn't involve an optometrist. That explains a lot.

It's an easter egg.

From the shape of it, quite literally.
Oh come on OP, make up your mind! First you say one eye is smaller than the other, then you say one eye is bigger than the other... Which one is it!?!

Oh come on OP, make up your mind! First you say one eye is smaller than the other, then you say one eye is bigger than the other... Which one is it!?!

Depends which eye you look at it with. O_o

Depends which eye you look at it with. O_o

Or is it o_O ? PERSPECTIVE!
They evolved from Crazy Frog!

Oh come on OP, make up your mind! First you say one eye is smaller than the other, then you say one eye is bigger than the other... Which one is it!?!

Funny you should say that as I used to be indecisive but now I'm not so sure....
One eye evolved to be smaller so they'd have less mass for spaceflight.
Maybe its odd effect of g-forces on Kerbal heads
It's probably evolved from all their ancestors smacking their faces on the dashboards of previous exploits (invention of the horse and buggy, etc) and exploding in glorious ways.
